| Eye level | 눈높이 | Shows the subject at eye level, creating a natural and neutral perspective | Provides a sense of realism, creates a sense of empathy with the subject | Used in portrait photography, dialogue scenes in film |
| High angle | 고각도 | Shows the subject from above, often used to create a sense of vulnerability or inferiority | Creates a sense of power dynamics, emphasizes the environment | Used in action scenes, establishing shots in film |
| Low angle | 저각도 | Shows the subject from below, often used to create a sense of power or superiority | Creates a sense of power dynamics, emphasizes the subject | Used in hero shots, establishing shots in film |
| Dutch angle | 디트취 | Shows the scene at an angle, often used to create a sense of unease or tension | Creates a sense of distortion and imbalance, emphasizes the emotional tone | Used in horror movies, action scenes |
| Worm's eye view | 지렁이시점 | Shows the subject from a very low angle, creating a sense of grandeur or drama | Emphasizes the subject's power or importance, creates a sense of grandeur | Used in hero shots, establishing shots in film |
| Aerial shot | 공중촬영 | Shows the scene from a high altitude, often used to provide an overview of the environment | Provides context and scale, emphasizes the environment | Used in landscape photography, establishing shots in film |
| Crane shot | 크레인샷 | Shows the scene from a moving crane, often used to create a sense of dynamism or movement | Provides a unique perspective, creates a sense of dynamism | Used in action scenes, music videos |
| Steadicam shot | 스테디캠 | Shows the scene with a camera mounted on a stabilizing rig, often used to create a smooth and stable shot | Creates a sense of fluidity and stability, emphasizes the subject | Used in action scenes, documentary filmmaking |
| Handheld shot | 핸드헬드 | Shows the scene with a handheld camera, often used to create a sense of immediacy or chaos | Creates a sense of realism and intimacy, emphasizes the emotional tone | Used in mockumentaries, found footage films |
| Tilt shot | 틸트샷 | Shows the scene at a diagonal angle, often used to create a sense of instability or tension | Creates a sense of distortion and imbalance, emphasizes the emotional tone | Used in horror movies, action scenes |
| Pan shot | 팬샷 | Shows the scene with a horizontal movement of the camera, often used to follow the action or show the environment | Creates a sense of continuity and movement, emphasizes the environment | Used in travel videos, nature documentaries |
| Zoom shot | 줌샷 | Shows the scene with a change in focal length of the camera, often used to create a sense of intimacy or tension | Creates a sense of focus and intimacy, emphasizes the emotional tone | Used in music videos, romantic comedies |
